text: Bottle at Akkurat. Deep reddish with off white lacing. Big grape aroma and taste with some funky, tart, oaky notes. Highly vinous Dry and smooth.
Bottle at Akkurat Sthlm. Tart and dry but pretty smooth. Grape juice, red wine vinegar and citrus water.

0,05l from bottle at mbcc green session shared by / with the crew. orange hazy color, small white head. smells quite funky, barnyard, bit grassy, leathery, quite cheesy, very nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes grassy, green apples, rather citric, some, leathery. finishes dry and medium sour with notes of grass, citrus and some funk. great one.

8, 4, 8, 3, 17

duft: frisk grape citrus lime lidt svag appelsin 
smag syrlig citrus frisk tÃ¸r
DVD. Deep reddish. Loads of raspberries, tart,minerals, funk, light barn. Quite sour, grapes, det wooden, touch of marzipan(raspberries pits), fruity with a sweet touch.
Bottle - Vinous red notes and some petrol notes. Deep clear red. Red wine skin, dry and decent acidity. Dry and very vinous with just a hint of lambic funk and sourness

Bottle shared by Ryan at his May 2017 tasting - thanks man. Pours a deep reddish purple body with off white lacing. Nose is sour grapes, grape juice, funk and tart oak. Mouthfeel is light bodied and tart with notes of grape, sour cherries, tart berries and restrained sour funk character. Great lambic blend.

Bottle care of Ryan at his epic lambic session. Pours a purple color with a smaller sized off white head. Notes of grape skins, sour fruit, and oak. Some cranberries pinot noir grapes, and cherries as it opens up. Not overly acidic or sharp. Very enjoyable.

Sample @ CBC Boston, 2016. Reddish / purple pour with a small pink head. Nose is moderately jammy. Red grape. Some gentle oaky accents. Moderately tart red berry flavor. Cheese rind and old cork. Drift wood. Mild brett. Light body, active carb. Nice.

Sample at Ã–lrepubliken during GBG Beer Week 2017. Hazy red with off white head. Sour funky with grapes. Very much like a carbonated biodynamic wine. Semi dry with medium acidity and medium carbonation.

(Bottle sample @ CBC 2016 Green Session, Copenhagen) Pours purplish red with a small pinkish head. Aroma of red grapes, tart red berries, barnyard funk, wood. Flavour of tart red grapes and currants, vinous with a little residual sweetness for balance, some dusty, barnyard-y sort of funk, wood, dry finish. Still, medium bodied. Nice stuff, good wine concentration!

From bottle at olrepubliken sour fest. Poured a deep dark red colour, like a rich red wine. Nose is amazingly grape forward, big sweet grapes, merlot, light sweet cherry pit, dusty, citrus, grains, big grape taste, amazingly how much grape forward this is. Prefer this one over lamvinus
A: Hazy deep red/purple/brownish N: Grapes, green apple, oak T: Lemon, fresh grapes, oak, unripe apple O: Well balanced tartness and bitterness. A bit heavy on the oak, still pretty nice.

Bottle 750ml. corked. [ As Bokkereyder Druiven 2015 ].Clear dark red color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white - pink head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy berries - fruity - grapes, barnyard, leather, funky, wood - oak. Flavor is moderate sweet and acidic with a long long duration, barnyard, citric - lemony tart, tart berries ala cheery - raspberry, grapes - red grapes, wood - oak, funky, super dry. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20161229]
 8-5-9-4-17

Bottled. Pours hazy deep red with a small pinkish off-white head. Aroma of cherries, red grapes, wood, lemon and brett. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up being dry and tart. Medium bodied, watery to oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice Lambic indeed. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ

75 cl bottle. Pours hazy red with a pink head. Aroma is dry fruity, citric and mellow fruity. Smooth fruity. Lingering and citric. Fruity far finish. Mellow fruity. Citric and smooth cherry to raspberry fruity finish.
75 cl. Bottle. Hazy ruby colour with a red head. Aroma and flavour of grapes, berries, spice, fruit and tartness.

Draught as Dornfelder Lambic. Red coloured. Small whitish head. Aroma. Sourness, grape, vinegar, berries, earth. Flavour. Sourness, barnyard, earth, leather, vinegar, grapes and berries. MEdium to full bodied. ENds sour and grapish. Quite dry and acidic. Nice.

Bottled. A hazy deep red beer with a thin beige head. The aroma has notes of cherries, grapes, brettanomyces, and dust. The flavor is acidic with a sweet edge and notes of brettanomyces, lemons, cherries, grapes, and wood, leading to a tart finish.
Aroma of barnyard, gooseberries, white currants, grape, elderflower, bright citrus, very complex. Taste of barnyard, bright citrus, light oak, a bit quick finish. Best bokkereyder on aroma.
Bottle (750 ml) @ Koelship, Copenhagen 20161001. Fruity, acidic, funky, woody, berries, grapes, medium body with a watery texture. The finish is dry, funky and woody.
Bottle @ Koelschip, Copenhagen 1/10-16. Fruity and bretty with red grapes, cherries and black currrant, also acidic. Body is medium, the finish is dry, fruity and woody with red grapes.
Bottle from koelship copenhagen. Pours a light red colour beer with a small head. Fruity and bretty with typical red grapes and wood. Dry finish
Bottle - pours purple pink head - nose/taste of red grapes, pinot, oak, funky sour hay - medium body
Pours a bright vibrant raspberry red with a thin pink around the rim lacing. Aroma is berry, cherry and vinegar
Keg at cbc16 deep red... Thin white lacing.. Soft barnyard funk nose.. Soft barnyard funk tart Berries
CBC. Red with tiny head. Aroma is malt, berries, tart, wood and barnyard. Flavour is malt, berries, grapes, medium sweet, little sour, tart, lemon, little citrus and barnyard.
Bottle. Cloudy golden color, flat. Nice aroma of wet horse blanket and distant barns. Taste is dusty overripe grapes. Delicious.

Sampled at Nacht van de Grote Dorst 2016. - Bref: emulates the depth and grape(/red berry freshness of Cantillon St. Lamvinus, using a mix of pinot and other EU grapes. Funk smothered by a juicy wealth of red grapes, currants, blackberry and their tanninic peels make this surprisingly enganging and more sessionable than the blenders intended, bringing only very limited bottles. What is the base lambiek here?
Sample @ CBCÂ’16, Copenhagen. Green session. Still deep red pour. Tons of grapes, vinous, some apple, funky, oak and a lingering tartness.
Tap @ CBC2016. Pours deep dark red, no head. Notes is light vinegary, leathery, grapey, dusty, barnyard.

Draught @ CBC. Pours deep red, no head. Aroma of light sourness, barnyard, dusty, leather, red grapes. Flavor is light sourness, light sweet, wood, dusty, barnyard, fruity, grapes. Medium body, average carbonation, light acidic finish. 130516
CBC. Hazy deep red without head. Aroma is sweet, malty, red grapes, wood and barnyard. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 140516

[5/14/16] Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Green session. Lovely deep purple with a pink head. Great aroma of barnyard, grapes, wood. Tart flavor with barnyard, oak, grapes. Medium-bodied. Great.
Sample at CBC 2016. Fruity smell with red berries. Tart taset with a deep fruity aroma, with black currant and cherries. Very nice!

Sample at CBC 2016. 

Dark red with a small head. Aroma and taste of cherries, funk, oak and wood. The body was medium and the carbonation relaxed. The finish was dry. A nice one.
On tap at CBC 2016 - day 2. Lambic funk and a ton of grapes in this one, notes of red wine, as well.

@Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016, GREENreddish hazy. Ripe red berries, curranty nose. Tart, biting. Tart red berries, hay maÃ¶ts. Intense, bit short tho for the nose.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

CBC 2016. Pours red color with a thin white head. 
Bretta,Â  horse stable,Â  red berries in aroma. 
Tart,Â  mouthdrying finish. 
Â  Red berries,Â  horse stable, soury flavor. Tasty.
Tap at CBC2016, Copenhagen. Colour is clear red with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Berries, red berries, sweetness and sourness.
On tap at CBC 16 Green Session. Pours a clearish red with a small off-white head. Dry and tart with aromas of sour cherries. Medium bodied. Medium to soft carbonation. Dry and tart finish.
CBC. Deep red with a lasting pink head. Aroma with funk, red berries, wood and a faint medicinal note. Very dry and tart flavour with red wine, red berries and a touch of wood

CBC Â’16. Hazy purple with a ring pink head. Tart red grape aroma with vinous notes and soft light dry funk. Really fruity and showing off the grape character. Flavour is above light sweet and light to moderate sour. Light medium bodied with very soft carbonation.
